content:
Diagnosis:	Squamous cell carcinoma of left floor of mouth

Management:	12 Mar 2024 Incisional biopsy
		20 Mar 2024 Left neck dissection levels I-IV

Histology:	Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma
	pT2N1M0 (AJCC 8th Ed)
	Single level IIA node positive (2/18)
	No extranodal extension
	PDL1 CPS 30%

Current Situation:	Post-operative review prior to adjuvant treatment

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his recent neck dissection. He has made an excellent recovery from surgery with good wound healing and no complications. His speech and swallowing have returned to normal, and he reports only mild neck stiffness which is improving with prescribed exercises. His main concern is returning to work as a carpenter, which we agreed would be possible after completing planned adjuvant treatment.

On examination today, the surgical sites are well healed with no evidence of local recurrence. Neck movements are slightly restricted but improving. No palpable cervical lymphadenopathy.

I have discussed the histology results which confirm a T2N1 squamous cell carcinoma with a single positive lymph node. Given the nodal involvement, I have recommended adjuvant radiotherapy to the primary site and left neck. This would involve 30 treatments over 6 weeks. The main side effects of dry mouth, taste changes, and skin reaction were discussed.

The plan is to proceed with radiotherapy planning CT next week, aiming to start treatment in 2 weeks. We will see him weekly during radiotherapy in the treatment review clinic.

primary_cancer.site: oral cavity, left floor of mouth
primary_cancer.metastases: single positive lymph node level IIA
primary_cancer.histopathology_status: moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, no extranodal extension

cancer_timeline.value: Left neck dissection levels I-IV, 2/18 nodes positive
Histology confirms pT2N1M0 moderately differentiated SCC, single level IIA node positive, no extranodal extension

patient_facts.value: Mild neck stiffness, improving with exercises
Well healed surgical sites, no evidence of local recurrence, slightly restricted neck movements, no palpable cervical lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: Recently diagnosed oral cavity SCC with single nodal involvement, post-operative recovery proceeding well, planned for adjuvant radiotherapy
Good post-operative recovery with return of normal speech and swallowing
Weekly review during planned 6-week course of radiotherapy
